text: is a Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Sakamoto was born in Tochigi Prefecture on July 7, 1992. After graduating from Tokiwagi Gakuen High School, she joined Urawa Reds in 2011.Urawa Reds She moved to AC Nagano Parceiro in 2015.AC Nagano Parceiro She played 69 matches until 2018. In 2019, she moved to NHK Spring Yokohama FC Seagulls. She left the club end of 2020 season.NHK Spring Yokohama FC Seagulls In 2012, Sakamoto was selected the Japan U-20 national team for 2012 U-20 World Cup. Japan won the 3rd place. On July 30, 2017, she debuted for the Japan national team against Australia. ==Statistics== List of match in 2017 at Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 2017 1 0 Total 1 0 ==References== ==Other websites== * *Japan Football Association Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Tochigi Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Urawa Red Diamonds Ladies players Category:AC Nagano Parceiro Ladies players
title: Riho Sakamoto
